adenotonsillar hypertrophy.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Adenotonsillar hypertrophy and chronic otitis media.

chronic otitis media.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Adenotonsillar hypertrophy and chronic otitis media.

tympanostomy and tube placement.context: Procedure Performed: 1. Tympanostomy and tube placement.

fulgurated adenoid bed.context: With the Bovie set at 50 coag and the suction Bovie tip on the suction hose, the adenoid bed was fulgurated by beginning at the posterosuperior aspect of the nasopharynx at the apex of the choana placing the tip of the suction cautery deep at the root of the adenoids next to the roof of the nasopharynx and then in a linear fashion making serial passages through the base of the adenoid fossa in parallel lines until the entire nasopharynx and adenoid bed had been fulgurated moving from posterior to anterior.

ceruminous debris.context: The left external auditory canal was examined under the operating microscope and cleaned of ceruminous debris.

fluid in middle ear space.context: Fluid was suctioned from the middle ear space, and a tympanostomy tube was placed at the level of the incision and pushed into position with the Rosen needle.

tympanostomy tube placement.context: Fluid was suctioned from the middle ear space, and a tympanostomy tube was placed at the level of the incision and pushed into position with the Rosen needle.

Cortisporin ear drops.context: Cortisporin ear drops were instilled into the canal, and a cotton ball was placed in the external meatus.
